reviewText: This truly a GREAT MOVIE 2 watch. Almost everything and everyone in this movie are OUTSTANDING. The only item that would need a little work on is the blood. MGM could have spent a little more money on props/effects. It is very obvious that paint was used because of the bright color, density and thickness. Edgar Allen Poe,Vincent Price and Christopher Lee's works are real Classics. This is originally referred to as Edgar Allen Poe's Classic Tale of The Living Dead, The Oblong Box. If you are interested in Edgar Allen Poe, I found this website to really informative: [...]
summary: Well Worth Watching-Even More Than Once
Title: Edgar Allan Poe's THE OBLONG BOX

reviewText: Vincent Price and Christopher Lee are amazing. They were unique and no else has ever been able to replace them.
summary: Good old horror movie to watch.
Title: Edgar Allan Poe's THE OBLONG BOX

reviewText: The screen play contains an oblong box and premature burial. However, Edger Allen Poe's story is different. Yes, watchthis movie for the fun of it, but I also recommend reading the original Oblong Box; It's a classic.
Title: Edgar Allan Poe's THE OBLONG BOX

reviewText: it had everything a horror fan wants; Vincent Price was so over the top, I thought he needed oxygen. lush costumes, everything done just so. you got your money's worth(75 cents) back then.
Title: Edgar Allan Poe's THE OBLONG BOX

reviewText: I am just a fan of Vincent Price. I really like most of his movies. They are like a blast from the past and I enjoy watching them.
Title: Edgar Allan Poe's THE OBLONG BOX

reviewText: For the age, this movie was okay. The story was decent, and weird enough that I watched all of it to find out what would happen. I don't need to see it again.Do older movies just get slapped with a PG rating? This movie has a frenzied tavern scene where men and women are paired off, and a number of women have their clothing ripped. The scene contains full-view, topless women which was unexpected. The violence is nothing like in today's films, but there's plenty of killing.
summary: Eh, it was okay, not PG
Title: Edgar Allan Poe's THE OBLONG BOX

reviewText: I dont know if poe wrote this one but its a great movie I hope he did. I hope if he did they got close to what the story was about.
Title: Edgar Allan Poe's THE OBLONG BOX

reviewText: I really don't need to retell this story,You know it by now. I watch all amazon instant & prime on My Kindle Fire the picture & the sound is the best( I use headphones to listen ) the Fire does have great speakers.This is not the best of Vincent Price or Christopher Lee in the Horror movies,but it will keep You watching & loving every minute.A great buy especially for free ( with amazon prime ).
Title: Edgar Allan Poe's THE OBLONG BOX

reviewText: I was a bit alarmed by Edgar Allan Poe's racism/ethocentrism.  He thought there were cannibals in Nigeria when I believe the only cannibals in the world are some isolated peoples in South America and in New Guinea.  Otherwise this was a very spine chilling tale of someone being buried alive and crawling out of a grave.  Of a man who hates his brother because he is different/mentally ill.  In the end justice is meted out, as usually it is in Edgar Allan Poe tales.Vincent Price is always a very good actor.  This movie is low budget however.
summary: Vincent Price is always a very good actor. This movie is low budget however
Title: Edgar Allan Poe's THE OBLONG BOX

reviewerName: Scotman's Film & Book Reviews "Film & Book Re...
reviewText: This was the last film American International Pictures did in the Poe series and unfortunately has little to do with the Poe classic.  Much tragedy hit this film as it was being produced, with one of the screenwriters dying 11 days into production.  What's up with that?The Oblong BoxThe film has a lot of atmosphere, dark colors, eerie Psycho-like music and debauchery from colonial Britain ripping off the Africans and treating them badly.  In retaliation for killing a boy from a tribe that worked a family-owned plantation, one of the Markum brothers got a voodoo curse (the start of the film has Edward being nailed to a tree, ouch).  It's a very pro-Black, anti-colonial Britain film in a lot of ways.Edward returns to England mad (as in totally nuts) and Julian (Vincent Price) has Edward locked and chained in his room.  Unable to escape, Edward hatches a plot with a witchdoctor and Julian's family lawyer, Trench. Trench has a mind of his own however, and in the confusion kinda "forgets" that Edward is pretending to be dead in an oblong box and ends up being buried alive.That would have been the end of the film right there but for Christopher Lee's character, a creepy doctor who likes to experiment on cadavers, the warmer the better.  As Dr. Newhartt collects Edward's remains, the remains reach up and attempt to choke the good doctor and through blackmail gets his cooperation.The overall story is somewhat predictable with a few twists and turns to keep the viewer entertained.  The prostitutes in a bar, the barfights, the murders that Edward performs (but the blood is so fake and the slashing of the throats looks very unrealistic).Four stars are mainly for the sympathetic Julian and the murderous Edward (played callously by British actor Alister Williamson).  Edward's on and off sexy maid girlfriend Sally (Sally Geeson) was a bit flighty and weird but cute, in a horror sort of way.  Hilary Dwyer (Witchfinder General (aka The Conqueror Worm from Matthew Hopkins)andCry of the Banshee / Murders in the Rue Morguealso with Price)  plays the overemotional fiancee to Julian.Recommend seeing with Scream and Scream Again, the second film where several of the actors in Oblong Box return for an encore.The Oblong Box / Scream and Scream Again
summary: The Merchant of Menace Strikes Again!
Title: Edgar Allan Poe's THE OBLONG BOX
